title: Bi-Weekly Movies, TV Shows, Documentaries & Podcasts Discussion Thread
selftext:
So, what is r/India watching of late?

Watched any premieres yesterday? Loved any movie that you saw recently and are dying to discuss it? Discovered any new series lately? Well, this is your space. Go crazy!

This is not just limited to Hollywood/Bollywood, nor to any particular language.

Feel free to share short films, or podcasts of your choice, too, and ask for recommendations for what to watch!

**Movies and Shows Thread is posted every two weeks on Saturday mornings |** [**Old Threads**](https://reddit.com/r/india/search?q=Movies+thread+discussion+&restrict_sr=on&sort=new&t=all)

https://preview.redd.it/e3cqi5nuw8n61.png?width=1487&format=png&auto=webp&s=c6623226acf7856bb5a61313af7bec382c8525f1
comments: Did people actually like Brahmastra? I posted a rant on r/bollywood and they perma banned me saying 'flaming hate post'.
I couldn't go past 30 minutes. They keep repeating 'shiva' like every 10 seconds.

It's almost time for the #SmartprixAwards2022 and categories have now been revealed.  
  
If you would like to nominate your favorite product.  
  
Categories are:  
  
Smartphones  
  
Laptops  
  
TVs  
  
Audio  
  
Smartwatches
I liked it. Watched with my wife in IMAX 3D. Worth it. If you can like Marvel's things, than Brahmastra is yet another similar thing. I actually like that Bollywood is attempting those things.
What little trailer and clips i saw, i do not want to waste my 3hrs.
Has anyone watched ‘The peripheral’ on Prime video? There’s like 6 episodes out and It’s honestly pretty different with a new concept and twist over a pretty common sci-fi theme now.

Watching House of the Dragon. Planning to watch Madras, by Pa. Ranjith, Kantara and Ponniyin Selvan.

BTW did anyone here see Kantara?
I watched TENET recently. If you want to fuck the brain out of you, it's a good watch.
Good show, the only criticism I have is it could be more compact and faster paced.
Also, anyone here watching or reading Chainsaw Man?
Wednesday is a good watch. Well produced.
I second this.  Wednesday was a fun watch!

Pantheon. It is an absolutely amazing story and fantastic execution. Finished it in one sitting!

Also has some really unrealistic depiction of an Indian telecom company.
I liked it because I focused on the story. The story is good and has great potential but the execution is poor and acting is subpar
Yep. It's amazing. Never felt bored.
Nice. All I know is that it is a Kannada movie so as a Karnataka native I felt quite proud to see it become so popular.
currently watching the anime and calling it amazing would be an understatement.

I actually like that Bollywood is attempting those things. What little trailer and clips i saw, i do not want to waste my 3hrs. Has anyone watched ‘The peripheral’ on Prime video?
